reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Procurement of measles vaccines and Measles, Mumps, Rubella (MMR) vaccines for all Lebanese and non-Lebanese children from 6 to 11 months nationally and 1-9 years of age children) in 4 governorates (Akkar, North, Bekaa and Baalbeck Hermel).

description.narrative:
To promptly respond to the current measles outbreak, and immediately interrupt the transmission of measles, the WHO mission recommended to the MoPH to undertake a national immunization campaign, which will be conducted in September 2019, targeting children 6 months to 9 years of age. September was proposed as the optimum timing taking advantage of the school and nurseries registration to reach out to the proposed target, especially the 2 years to 10 years of age children that are considered the reservoir of the virus. To stop the spread of the outbreak, the first wave of the campaign is non-selective targeting all children most at risk with two different vaccine based on the age cohort:
- Measles vaccine for all children of 6 to 11 months of age: the whole national cohort of children from 6 to 11 months of age will be targeted, estimated at 70,000 children in the whole Lebanon.
- Measles, Mumps, Rubella (MMR) vaccine to all children from 1 year to 9 years, residing in Great North (Akkar and North governorates) and Great Bekaa (Bekaa and Baalbeck Hermal governorates), where Measles attack is currently at a pick. A total of 385,000 children from 1 to 9 years of age will be targeted in above mentioned governates from this funding proposal out of total overall 814,000 children from 1 to 9 years of age at national level).
This proposed project will be a partial but significant contribution to a national measles campaign which would overall target a total of 70,000 children between 6 to 11 months of age for vaccination with measles vaccine and 814,000 children between 1 to 9 years of age for vaccination with Measles Mumps Rubella (MMR) vaccine. UNICEF’s role in the campaign, with close coordination with Ministry of Public Health (MoPH) and World Health Organization (WHO), will be to procure the Measles and MMR vaccines with all related commodities (such as cold boxes, syringes, alcohol swaps), and contribute, in collaboration with other health partners, for the community mobilization activities and the mass media campaign at national level. UNICEF will also coordinate with World Health Organization (WHO), who will be responsible for the operational part of the campaign (such as supervision, microplanning, training, recruiting vaccinators). WHO has mobilized USD 500,000 dollars to contribute to the operational cost, and fundraising is going on to complement the required envelop. Additionally, based on the MoPH recommendation during the EPI steering committee meeting (June 7th), oral polio vaccine will also be provided to all children from 6 months to less than 10 years of age (this will be funded through other donors/sources). The MoPH has convene the National EPI Steering committee to review the WHO recommendation at take the final decision on the National measles campaign, both on scope (selective non selective), scale (geographical target), quality of vaccines (Single dose or multiple doses vials, Measles containing vaccine versus Measles Mumps Rubella combined vaccines) to be used, and the strategic approach ( public versus private sector, cross sector approach with Ministry of Education to target school age children).
WHO will fund-raise for the operational cost of the campaign (the operational cost includes the nurses, logistics personnel, supervisors, data entry clerks, intra-campaign monitoring and post campaign monitoring, micro-planning and training). WHO and UNICEF will participate in joint fund raising efforts for the campaign, as such on June 20 a planned donors meeting will take place, where several donors will be approached for the campaign funding.
